div.p:
I have looked into the matter of Miss Edgeworth's
Works with some care, but find myself at a loss how to
make an offer, as I should not like to make one that
would not be satisfactory; in my capacity as Manager
for others, I have to look to their interests, and as most of
the present proprietors of the Copyrights have been but
very little benefitted by their poor chases, and as the stock
now on hand renders it doubtful whether some of
the works will be required to be reprinted for some years
to come, they may think that portion of little value;
indeed it appears doubtful whether any of those in
the collected works, except the Moral and Popular Tales
will ever be reprinted separately again; still I am of
opinion that it will be better for the parties to
have it in their power to protect the whole during
the time the new Act allows. These remarks apply
principally to the articles which form the Works. 18 Vols.
but I find that the Sale of the Juvenile Works has
decreased very much during the last Seven years.

The following is an account of the present state
of the books, which I shall feel obliged by your
sending to Miss Edgeworth, and I should be very glad
to have a Sum fixed for the renewal of the whole;

then call a meeting of the Partners, whose consent
I must obtain before I can take upon myself
to conclude any agreement
div.closer:
I am, my dear Sir
Yours very truly,
Mr R. Hunter
Richard Marshall

postscript.p:
The Parent's Assistant
From 1822 to 1834 the sale was at the rate of
800 packages; in 1834, 2500 were printed and were
not sold till Feby. 1840. In Feby. 1840 an edition
of 2000 was printed; of this, 1500 are now on hand

Early Lessons Vol 1 & 2
Up to 1835, Sold about 1000 per lesson
3500 were printed and Sold between September
1835, & December 1841. December 1844 an Edition
of 2000 was printed and there are now
about 1600 - on hand

Early Lessons, Vol 3 & 4
March 1825 to December 1835, sold at the rate
of 650 per lesson. 2500 were printed, and sold
from December 1835 to December 1841. In December
1841, 2000 were printed of which 1700 are on hand

Rosamond 2 Vols.
2000 were printed in 1830, and were not sold
till April 1842, when 1500 were printed;
most of these are still on hand.

Frank - 3 Vols. 2000 were printed in 1837, and
about 400 are now on hand

Harry and Lucy 3 Vols.
2000 were printed in 1837; of these about
900 remain on hand. The Trustees of
Messos Baldwin & Co deciding that Her work was
not selling so well as wished, sold a considerable
number to the trade at a reduced price
Of the works contained in the collected edition of
18 Vols. the only ones printed separately since
1826, are Moral Tales 2 Vol , 1500 in 1826.
Popular Tales 2 Vols 1000 in 1827.
and 1500 in 1839.
Of these, about 800 went ot make up Sets of
the works, and there are now 550 on hand, besides
those in the Works 18 Vols.

Castle Rackrent 750 in 1827.
Of the Works 18 Vols about 1500 copies were on hand
in 1840, and these were sold at a reduced price,
and over and above what may remain of those
sets unsold, there is the following
783 Castle Rackrent and Irish Bulls 1 Vol
422 Moral Tales 2 Vols, and 200 Vol 2
550 Popular Tales 2 Vols, named above & 75. Vol 2
- Fashionable Tales, & Modern Griselda, 5 Vols
No Complete Sets, but about 500 odd Vols.
342. Belinda 2 Vols
478 Leonora and Literary Ladies 1 Vol.
435 Patronage 3 Vols
510 Harrington 1 Vol, and 469 Ormond 1 Vol.
